TopicTitle: Game crashed - and asked me to submit a file -- Where?

Articles.Content: Where do I post crash logs?

Odds are it's a RAM based crash. These are pretty common (especially with mods and such installed, or after playing for a while), the only thing posting about it on the forums will do is clutter up the support forum. Crash logs aren't everything, and the developers don't need five squillion core dumps saying the exact same thing. On the off chance it was not just a RAM-based crash, they/we need more info than just the crash log. Can you tell me what you were doing at the time? Can you reliably reproduce the crash by following a certain set of steps? Was it a freeze or did it just pop you back to desktop? Are you running OS X (what version?), Windows (what version?), Linux (what version/flavor/build/thing?) What are your system specs? (CPU, RAM, GPU) Most importantly, do you have any mods installed? Make a thread with that info, and wait for a reply. (However, if you can't reliably reproduce the crash, it's probably RAM based. Don't bother. Just suck it up and pray for 1.1.)

Would like the answer to this as well. I have multiple crashes (between 2 and 4) on every version since 1.02 that are definitely not memory related crashes. They usually happen when reverting flight to the SPH.

Well, it always says that, but everyone just ignores it. I don't know why they keep that message in. If everyone were to clog up the forums with crash logs, it would be impossible to organize, and there's no way that the developers would have time to go through every crash log. Usually just ignore posting the crash logs unless you have a specific issue that you want help with.
